word_mean: 躯体：人或动物的躯干及其内脏
体部：任何器官的最大最重要的部分，另见corpus和soma
刀体，刀具上夹持刀条或刀片的部分，或由它形成切削刃的部分。
弯体病， curved disease 一般认为是由于重金属盐类中毒或缺乏某种营养物质（如钙和维生素等）引起的鱼体畸形病。病鱼身体发生“S”形弯曲，有时只尾部弯曲，鳃盖凹陷或嘴部上下颌和鳍条等都出现畸形，严重时引起病鱼死亡。

sentences.en: In space, all bodies attract other bodies.

jx.jx_en_mean: involving every aspect of a person; completely

lj.lj_ly: the company owned them body and soul.
lj.lj_ls: 他们完全属于这家公司。

jx.jx_en_mean: stay alive, especially in difficult circumstances

lj.lj_ly: do you think a man can keep body and soul together by selling coconuts?.
lj.lj_ls: 你以为靠卖椰子就能活命？。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to emphasize that one completely opposes something and would do anything to prevent it from happening
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)［表示强调］在自己拼死反对某事的情况下

lj.lj_ly: she moves into our home over my dead body.
lj.lj_ls: 她不顾我极力反对搬到我们家来。

entry.def: Your body is all your physical parts, including your head, arms, and legs.

example.ex: The largest organ in the body is the liver.
example.tran: 人体最大的器官是肝脏。

entry.def: You can also refer to the main part of your body, except for your arms, head, and legs, as your body .
entry.tran: 躯干（不包括头和四肢）；躯体

example.ex: Lying flat on the floor, twist your body on to one hip and cross your upper leg over your body.
example.tran: 平躺在地板上，屈体侧躺，把上面的一条腿搭在身上。

entry.def: You can refer to a person's dead body as a body .

example.ex: Officials said they had found no traces of violence on the body of the politician.
example.tran: 官员称他们没有在这位政治家的尸体上发现暴力侵犯的痕迹。

entry.def: A body is an organized group of people who deal with something officially.

example.ex: ...the Chairman of the policemen's representative body, the Police Federation.
example.tran: 警察的代表机构“警察协会”的主席

example.ex: ...the main trade union body, COSATU, Congress of South African Trade Unions.
example.tran: 最大的工会组织COSATU，即南非全国总工会

entry.def: A body of people is a group of people who are together or who are connected in some way.

example.ex: ...that large body of people which teaches other people how to teach.
example.tran: 向别人传授教学方法的那一大批人

entry.def: The body of something such as a building or a document is the main part of it or the largest part of it.
entry.tran: （建筑物、文件等的）主体，主要部分

example.ex: The main body of the church had been turned into a massive television studio...
example.tran: 该教堂的主体部分已被改造成了一个大型电视演播室。

example.ex: Give an introduction, followed by the body of the material, then a brief summary.
example.tran: 首先写序言，接下来是内容的主体部分，然后作简短的总结。

entry.def: The body of a car or aeroplane is the main part of it, not including its engine, wheels, or wings.

example.ex: The only shade was under the body of the plane.
example.tran: 唯一的阴凉处是飞机机身下面。

entry.def: A body of water is a large area of water, such as a lake or a sea.

example.ex: It is probably the most polluted body of water in the world.
example.tran: 这很可能是世界上受污染最严重的一片水域。

entry.def: A body of information is a large amount of it.

example.ex: An increasing body of evidence suggests that all of us have cancer cells in our bodies at times during our lives.
example.tran: 越来越多的证据表明，我们所有人一生中体内时有癌细胞存在。

entry.def: If you say that an alcoholic drink has body, you mean that it has a full and strong flavour.
A body is the same as a bodysuit .
You can say over my dead body to emphasize that you feel very strongly that something should not happen, and that you will do everything you can to prevent it.
entry.tran: （用于强调强烈反对）除非我死了，休想

example.ex: 'We'll have her over for dinner.' — 'Over my dead body!'

entry.def: You use body and soul to mean every part of you, including your mind and your emotions.

example.ex: He dedicated himself body and soul to the education of young men...
example.tran: 他全身心地投入到年轻人的教育中。

example.ex: She was now committed to the band, body and soul.
example.tran: 现在，她把全部心思都放到了乐队上面。

entry.def: If you keep body and soul together, you have enough money to provide what you need to live.

example.ex: He at first kept body and soul together by selling cartoons to the humorous papers.
example.tran: 他最初通过向幽默搞笑类报纸出售卡通漫画维持生计。

means.word_mean: 1. the entire physical structure of an organism (especially an animal or human being);

sentences.sentence: "he felt as if his whole body were on fire"

means.word_mean: 2. body of a dead animal or person;

sentences.sentence: "they found the body in the lake"

means.word_mean: 3. a group of persons associated by some common tie or occupation and regarded as an entity;

sentences.sentence: "the whole body filed out of the auditorium"

means.word_mean: 4. the body excluding the head and neck and limbs;

sentences.sentence: "they moved their arms and legs and bodies"

means.word_mean: 5. an individual 3-dimensional object that has mass and that is distinguishable from other objects;
6. a collection of particulars considered as a system;
7. the external structure of a vehicle;

sentences.sentence: "the body of the car was badly rusted"

means.word_mean: 8. the property of holding together and retaining its shape;

sentences.sentence: "when the dough has enough consistency it is ready to bake"

means.word_mean: 9. the central message of a communication;

sentences.sentence: "the body of the message was short"

means.word_mean: 1. invest with or as with a body; give body to

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bodig, of unknown origin

means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 博迪绰号，来源于中世纪英语及古英语，含义是“身体，躯干”(body,trunk)，可能指胖子

sentences.en: Conversely, someone with a small frame may have high body fat but a normal BMI.

sentences.cn: “懒惰不仅是休假，是放纵或是一种恶习，她对我们的大脑来说是不可或缺的，就像维生素D对身体一样……自相矛盾的是，“懒惰”对于完成任何工作来说都是必要的。”他说道。
sentences.en: "Idleness is not just a vacation, an indulgence or a vice; it is as indispensable to be brain as Vitamin D is to the body...[idleness]is, paradoxically, necessary to getting any work done," he argues.

sentences.cn: 你服用的每一种药物不仅对身体起作用，而且可能会改变你正在服用的任何其他药物的效果.
sentences.en: Each drug you take not only acts on the body but may also alter the effect of any other drug you are taking

sentences.en: Physical activity does the body good, and there’s growing evidence that it helps the brain too.

sentences.cn: 一般国际走秀模特的身体质量指数（BMI）低于16——按照世界卫生组织的标准，这个数值足以说明模特在忍饥挨饿。
sentences.en: The average international runway model has a body mass index (BMI) under 16—low enough to indicate starvation by the World Health Organization’s standard.
sentences.from: 16年12月四级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 你可能以为大学生在睡眠方面是专家，但是各种聚会、备 考、 个人问题以及一般的精神压力都会打破学生的睡眠习惯，而这会对身体和精神产生不利影响。
sentences.en: You  probably  think  college  students  are  experts  at  sleeping,   but  parties,  preparations for tests, personal  problems  and  general  stress  can  wreck  a  student’s  sleep  habits, which can be bad for the  body and the mind.

sentences.en: A body can more uniformly a straight line, there being no cause to change that motion.

sentences.en: Heat is continually being transferred from one body to another.

sentences.en: Heat never flows spontaneously from a cooler to a hotter body.

sentences.cn: 任何旋转的物体在其质心附近都有一个角动量.
sentences.en: Any rotating body has an angular momentum about its center of mass.

sentences.cn: 运动物体继续作直线运动的倾向叫惯性.
sentences.en: The tendency of a body in motion to continue ina straight line is known as inertia.

sentences.cn: 力使物体做圆周运动.
sentences.en: He force keeps the body moving in a circle.

sentences.cn: 在前一种情况下, 第一个物体实际上以原来的速度弹回.
sentences.en: In the former case, the first body rebounds with practically its original velocity.

sentences.en: The rate of change of velocity, for a given body, is directly proportional exerted on it.

sentences.cn: 一个物体对另一物体施力必然会受这另一物体的反作用力.

sentences.cn: 因为感觉蕴含者可被感觉的物体和感觉于其中发生的物体.
sentences.en: For perception implies a body perceived and a body in which perception takes place.

sentences.cn: 下一步我们设置物体的一些其它属性: 质量和惯性张量.
sentences.en: Next we set some other properties of the body: mass and the inertia tensor.

sentences.cn: 我们考虑从物体中切取的一个小微元体的平衡问题.
sentences.en: We consider the equilibrium of a small element cut out of the body.

sentences.cn: 物体沿着固定点在一个焦点上的椭圆轨道运动.
sentences.en: The body travels in an ellipse, the fixed point being at on focus.

sentences.cn: 任何物体, 当它被加热到足够的高温时, 就变成了一种光源.
sentences.en: Any body, when heated to a sufficient high temperature, becomes a source of light.

sentences.cn: 不正常的低或高体温会影响动物体各种不同的生理应答,包括低代谢率.
sentences.en: Abnormally low or high body temperatute effect a variety of physiologic responses including lowered metabolic rate.

sentences.cn: 如果没有转变物体运动的缘故原由,那么物体将作匀速直线运动.
sentences.en: B body can more uniformly and a line, there being no cause to change that motion.

sentences.cn: 互相接触的物体中,一物对另一物持续的压力; 压缩.
sentences.en: The application of continuous force by one body on another that it is touching; compression.

sentences.cn: 总之, 热总是从高温物体流向低温物体.
sentences.en: In short, heat flows from the warmer to the cooler body.

sentences.cn: 物体会保持静止的状态直到有力的作用.
sentences.en: A body will continue in a state of rest until acted upon.

sentences.cn: 太阳是一个统治着太阳系的壮观的物体.
sentences.en: The sun is the glorious body that dominates the solar system.

sentences.cn: 如果物体的角速度是改变的, 就说这个物体具有角加速度.
sentences.en: If the angular velocity of a body changes, it is said to have an angular acceleration.
